comment._content: LOC, note mistranscription of "O'Hara" from negative. Dorothea Warren O'Hara (1873–1972). American artist, particularly working in enamels and ceramics. In December, 1915 she won the Lifetime Membership Prize from the National Arts Club. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F1071FFA3E5F1773... "O'Hara was born in Missouri but settled in the New York area, where she was educated at the Chase School. The artist went on to become a noted craftswoman, expressing her talents in a wide range of media, including pottery and ceramics, sculpture, and painting. She was also a writer, active in the Pen and Brush Club and the American Ceramics Society. Newspaper articles from southern Connecticut in 1926 and 1932 give some insight into her activities at the time. O'Hara exhibited at the Panama Pacific International Exposition of 1915, at Paris Salons, and at the prestigious Grand Central Art Galleries in New York City. " www.rubylane.com/item/230729-JB02833/DOROTHEA-WARREN-OHAR... There is a profile of O'Hara, with photos of her and her studio, in the April, 1917 number of Art World magazine. books.google.com/books?id=KULnAAAAMAAJ&pg=PA92&dq...
